title: Creamy Mushroom Pasta
description: A rich and creamy pasta dish featuring mixed mushrooms in a velvety sauce. Perfect for a comforting vegetarian dinner that's ready in just 30 minutes.

ingredients.notes: Can substitute with any long pasta like linguine or spaghetti
Use cremini, shiitake, and button mushrooms for best flavor
Can substitute with half-and-half for lighter version
Leaves only, can substitute with 1 tsp dried thyme

instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add the fettuccine and cook according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water before draining.
While pasta cooks, clean and slice the mushrooms. Heat olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the mushrooms to the skillet and cook for 5-6 minutes until they release their moisture and start to brown. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the chopped onion and cook for 2-3 minutes until softened. Add the minced garlic and thyme, cooking for 1 minute until fragrant.
Reduce heat to medium and add the remaining 2 tbsp butter. Once melted, add the heavy cream and vegetable broth. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Add the grated Parmesan cheese and stir until melted and smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add the drained pasta to the sauce and toss to combine. If the sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta water a little at a time until desired consistency is reached.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately with extra Parmesan cheese on the side.
tips: Don't wash mushrooms under water - clean them with a damp paper towel to prevent them from becoming soggy
Cook mushrooms in batches if your pan is small to ensure they brown properly
Reserve pasta water - the starchy water helps bind the sauce to the pasta
Add a splash of white wine to the sauce for extra depth of flavor
For a vegan version, substitute heavy cream with coconut cream and use nutritional yeast instead of Parmesan
variations: Add spinach or arugula in the last minute of cooking for extra greens
Top with toasted pine nuts or walnuts for added crunch
Add sun-dried tomatoes for a burst of umami flavor
Use different mushroom varieties like porcini or morel for special occasions
